title: Exhibition Celebration: El Greco—Ambition and Defiance
title_display: Exhibition Celebration—El Greco: Ambition and Defiance
hero_caption: El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos). The Feast in the House of Simon, 1608–14. Gift of Joseph Winterbotham.
short_description: Come together with Sustaining Fellows to celebrate the opening of El Greco: Ambition and Defiance exhibition with a special exhibition overview and cocktail reception.
list_description: Celebrate the opening of El Greco: Ambition and Defiance exhibition with a special exhibition overview and cocktail reception.
description:
Join us as we celebrate this highly anticipated exhibition charting the career of the artist known simply as El Greco. Featuring over 55 works, the exhibition considers the astounding ambition that drove him to develop his remarkable style and continually reinvent his practice in pursuit of both professional success and a unique artistic vision.

This Sustaining Fellows program features a conversation between Rebecca Long, Patrick G. and Shirley W. Ryan Associate Curator of European Painting and Sculpture before 1750 and Megan Kosinski, exhibitions manager. Following the conversation, enjoy a private exhibition viewing and cocktail reception.

Please note that this event is only open to current Sustaining Fellows. Learn more about the Sustaining Fellows here.

Please contact Alonso Tapia at (312) 443-3188 or atapia2@artic.edu for more information.
buy_button_caption: Registration for this special event is closed.
